text: Has any president picked a fight with dead man? Trump is a one off. We’ve had lots of awful presidents, but he’s clearly lowered the bar.
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: Trump has nominated a supremely unqualified political hack to the #FederalReserve board. This, well, it rhymes with herd, will end up in @MikeCrapo's pocket. BTW, Moore is not an economist (upper case or lower). His only qualification is to play one on TV. #idpol
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: Trump's nominee to #FederalReserve was so wrong on the facts that he was banned from the @KansasCityStar newspaper. But then again that likely explains his nomination. http://www.cjr.org/united_states_project/stephen_moore_heritage_foundation_paul_krugman_kansas_city_star.php … via @cjr

text: We're living through a carnival of buncombe, as H.L. Mencken once wrote. What would the great cynic and social critic made of Trump? My @LewistonTribune column. Here's the link: http://bit.ly/2Hy9d0V
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: Rather like Butch Otter's tendency to let legislation become law without his signature. Kinda the political equivalent of punting on third down.
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: "The myth that tax cuts will pay for themselves continues to persist within the Republican Party, despite overwhelming evidence to the contrary." @MikeCrapo assured us all that the tax cuts would pay for themselves.
author: TheJohnsonPost

text:
Well, did she ever return? 
No she never returned and her fate is still unlearned (what a pity) 
She may ride forever 'neath the streets of Boise 
She's the journalist who never returned…
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: Idaho Republicans would never admit - and probably don't know - that urban renewal projects are one of the very, very tools Idaho local governments have to do big projects, build cities and grow the economy. They're about to screw that up - bigly. #idpol
author: TheJohnsonPost

text:
Standing by for @SenatorRisch to endorse this very orderly process from our very stable genius that changes decades of U.S. policy. 

BTW: Trump couldn't find the Golan Heights on a map.
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: It’s a nasty business these days with many nasty people. All the better reason for good guys to climb in the ring. Frank Church was 32 and had never held public office when he beat an incumbent R who was just as bad as Risch.
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: Getting close to the time for you to announce your candidacy. Jim Risch is up, for instance. #idpol
author: TheJohnsonPost

text:
Needless to say, Idaho has grown - Boise particularly - but you have to wonder how it might have been had Pioneer been built - coal trains, serious concerns about air pollution, big costs to ratepayers. 

And that is a bit of the rest of the story.
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: ...his belief that a multi-hundred million dollar coal plant (in 1976 dollars) might well bankrupt Idaho Power. He understood the consequences much better than the cheerleaders for coal did. And now 45 years later Idaho Power is moving fast to get out of coal.
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: Andrus helped fuel some of the attacks when he said in his PUC testimony that building Pioneer "would throw the growth switch" in southwestern Idaho, with many long-term and undesirable effects. His primary opposition however was based on the environmental costs and...
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: I remember while working for Andrus on his 1986 comeback campaign for governor that he was routinely attacked for his opposition to Pioneer. The attacks were usually along the lines that the decision had crippled the state's growth. Untrue, but a useful political attack.
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: Political opponents of the then-governor were outraged that he'd waded so publicly into the controversy. The PUC rejected Idaho Power's plans. Pioneer was never built, but for years the controversy continued.
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: Public opposition became intense enough that Ada County Commissioners put an advisory question on the ballot. The plant lost. Then Andrus delivered the coup de grace - he personally appeared before the PUC and voiced his opposition.
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: As the debate over Idaho Power's coal plant proposal steamed along in 1975, Andrus was getting regular private updates on the project from an insider with access to the company's thinking. He became convinced the project was environmentally and fiscal a loser.
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: My old friend Pat Ford wrote a great piece on the transformation of the Idaho PUC and utility regulation in the 1970s. In short: the days of the PUC being a backwater where utilities routinely got there way came to an abrupt end.
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: In 1973 Andrus had installed a pugnacious former Idaho labor leader, Bob Lenaghen, on the Idaho Public Utilities Commission. Andrus told Lenaghen that he expected him to be an advocate for consumers. He was all that and more.
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: The Idaho Conservation League (@idconservation) led the change to stop Pioneer and they had an ally in high places - former Governor Cecil D. Andrus. A Coal Free Idaho is Achievable
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: The proposed Pioneer Power plant, all 500 MGW, sparked a furious debate. Most industry groups, GOP legislators, etc. were in favor of the project with some worrying that Idaho would "run out of energy" if the plant were not built.
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: Interesting story here. Let me see if I can provide some historical context and for that you need to go back 45 years or more to when Idaho Power Company proposed to construct a massive coal fired power plan near Orchard, between Boise and Mountain Home. #idpol
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: Whoo...I'm conflicted. This one is pretty compelling, too. A Florida man found a grenade while fishing and then took the explosive to Taco Bell
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: Police: Florida man thought he stole opioids, got laxatives instead
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: Here we go. Official book release day for "Political Hell-Raiser." Available from @OUPress, Amazon and Barnes and Noble. Upcoming events are on my website: http://bit.ly/2DMtEDW  #Montana

text: Gotta love Washington reporters who think there must be some grand "strategy" here. It's just Trump being a narcissistic jerk with profound mental issues. He's been that, well, forever.

text: Only if they are rightwing conservatives.

text: No one other than Trump (and his fever swamp of followers) is trashing John McCain. Perhaps you should direct your statement toward the source. But, that would take some courage and character. #McCain
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: And McCain actually did what Don Jr. should have done when approached for a meeting with Russians - he went to the FBI.
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: You heard it here first. The legislature and @IdahoStPolice will come to regret this decision. Taking a stable, long-term source of funding from the State Police will sooner of later leave the guys in the black and whites subject to political whims when bucks get tight. #idleg
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: He's lying. Again. And all the time.
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: Did you also congratulate Trump for dishonoring a dead man? What a gutless wonder. Touting the jobs, ignoring the wholesale lack of character and decency. #McCain
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: The crudeness, the hatred, the total lack of self awareness, and the lies of this man know no bottom. And almost as bad @robportman and a replacement level gutless wonder named @boblatta sat quietly through the whole ugly mess. What a sorry, sorry spectacle.
author: TheJohnsonPost

text:

text: Hum...who said during a speech in 2016 that Trump as ''a phony, a fraud''... ''His promises are as worthless as a degree from Trump University." And this year said: "After he became the nominee, I hoped his campaign would refrain from resentment and name-calling. It did not."
author: TheJohnsonPost

text: Lovely irony that the nitwits in charge of #Brexit are being stymied by a Parliamentary ruling that dates back to 1604. Damn, the rules do matter.

text: I'm old enough (sadly) to remember when the #idleg entirely defunded public television - 1981, I think. Best led I ever wrote, with apologies to the Pogo comic strip, was for that evening's broadcast: "We have met the budget cuts and they is us..."
author: TheJohnsonPost

text:
In my @LewistonTribune column today I quote @MichaelALanza, a guy who knows a thing or two about how tough it is to get a citizen measure on the #Idaho ballot. Timely reading as the legislature considers making ballot access impossible.

Here is a link: http://bit.ly/2TO8QF3
author: TheJohnsonPost
